description: Unlock the full power of Excel by mastering formulas and functions for data analysis, automation, and decision-making.

sections.content: Formulas transform Excel from a simple grid into a powerful analytical engine. Whether you need to sum data, validate conditions, or search large tables, formulas and functions make it possible. This lesson will help you build a strong foundation and introduce advanced techniques for efficiency.
Think of formulas as a **language for Excel**. The more fluent you are, the faster you can solve problems and automate tasks.
Quick toggle: Select the reference in the formula bar and press **F4** to cycle between reference types.
Core Excel Functions You Must Know

data.code:
=SUM(A1:A10)       // Total
=AVERAGE(A1:A10)    // Mean
=COUNT(A1:A10)      // Count numbers
=MAX(A1:A10)        // Highest value
=MIN(A1:A10)        // Lowest value

=TRIM(A1)         // Remove spaces
=PROPER(A1)       // Capitalize each word
=LEFT(A1,5)       // First 5 chars
=CONCAT(A1,B1)    // Combine text
=TEXT(A1,"MM/DD/YYYY")  // Format date

=TODAY()         // Current date
=NOW()           // Date & time
=DATEDIF(A1,B1,"d")  // Days difference

=VLOOKUP(101, A2:D10, 2, FALSE)
=XLOOKUP("Apple", A2:A10, B2:B10, "Not found")
=INDEX(C2:C10, MATCH(101,A2:A10,0))

sections.content: Prefer **XLOOKUP** over VLOOKUPâ€”itâ€™s more powerful and flexible, eliminating common issues with column positions.
